definition: lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
to drip/to strain or filter/a trickle

sentences.english: He had written the book with great pains.
sentences.chinese: 他嘔心瀝血寫了這本書。

sentences.english: I have bled for this magazine.
sentences.chinese: 我爲這個雜誌嘔心瀝血。

sentences.english: Every day, he worked his heart out in the gardens.
sentences.chinese: 每天都會在花園裏辛勤勞作，嘔心瀝血。

sentences.english: Mr Li always selects exercises for us.
sentences.chinese: 李老師總是嘔心瀝血地爲我們精選習題。

sentences.english: Millions of Chinese have worked for years to this end.
sentences.chinese: 成千上萬的中國人嘔心瀝血多年，就是爲了這一天。

sentences.english: He worked indefatigably to train cadres in modern military science.
sentences.chinese: 爲造就具有現代軍事科學知識的幹部，伯承嘔心瀝血。

definition: to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
